intro: Astragalus pelliger, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep taproot system that allows it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus pelliger is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
